title: How to Make an Old Fashioned Currant Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to around 180ºC/350ºC (moderate).

text: Preheat the oven to around 180ºC/350ºC (moderate). Line or grease the cake pan. Cream the butter and sugar.  Fold in the egg yolks. Add the golden syrup and sour milk. Stir to combine. Add the sifted flour, cinnamon, mixed spice and nutmeg. Alternate gradually with the addition of the currants, raisins and ground cloves. Beat the 3 egg whites until stiff. Fold into the cake batter. Add the dissolved baking soda and mix through.  Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.  Place in the oven. Bake for around 2 hours. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven once baked. Cool on a wire cooling rack.

The cake is ready when a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven once baked.
Cool on a wire cooling rack.
